name: Intro
_source: s;Simon;The mythical Albreides Ridge in the heart of the mountains...
s;Simon;Never thought I'd actually see it.
s;Luther;This used to be the site of a lord's fort from long ago.
s;Luther;Before being overrun with bandits, of course.
s;Luther;Legends tell of large battlemage formations defending against assaults from dragonlords and their followers.
s;Juliet;I've heard all kinds of crazy stories about dragons from my uncle,{w} but soldiers following dragons?
s;Luther;Some view dragonlords as the pinacle of strength, and they worship the dragons as gods.
s;Luther;Ever-ravenous, an endless appetite for wealth, and the strength to take it all...
s;Luther;Followers of the dragon see this as the ideal existence.
s;Luther;But many of these followers have died out with the dragons.
s;Juliet;So these are what dragon followers look like then?
s;Luther;No, this is a larger threat.
s;Luther;That seems to be a Draconic Knight.
s;Luther;A soldier of immense strength granted near-immortality by a dragonlord's blessing.
s;Simon;Let's be cautious here. Nobody engage.
s;Simon;If we can sneak past while dealing with the bandits surrounding the ridge...
s;Juliet;What can you tell us about those weird floating books?
s;Luther;These must be artifacts from the ancient battlemages.
s;Luther;Tomes which warp the movement and flow of battle.
speak;Narrator;There are tomes scattered across the map that can affect MOV.{w}{br}Speed tomes will increase allies' MOV by 3 when destroyed.;StyleNid=hint
speak;Narrator;Slow tomes will reduce enemies' MOV by 3 when destroyed.;StyleNid=hint
